text: Chromolaena sagittata is a Mexican species of flowering shrub in the sunflower family. It is found in western Mexico, in the states of Sonora, Sinaloa, Nayarit, and Baja California Sur.Turner, B. L. 1997. The Comps of Mexico: A systematic account of the family Asteraceae, vol. 1 – Eupatorieae. Phytologia Memoirs 11: i–iv, 1–272. Chromolaena sagittata is an herb with opposite, arrow-shaped leaves about 2.5 cm (1 inch) long.Gray, Asa. 1852.
